content.body: i kind of already have that because test262-harness forces me to make a preprocessor to do anything useful

content.body: but what do yall prefer: a) nothing, jordan is just sad, b) replace all the `parseInt`s with `Function.prototype.call`s, c) tag all the tests relying on non-constructibility with a new made-up feature flag?

but what do yall prefer: a) nothing, jordan is just sad, b) replace all the parseInts with Function.prototype.calls, c) tag all the tests relying on non-constructibility with a new made-up feature flag?

content.body: to me a feature flag doesn't sound out of place; it may not be an engine capability that's being selected for, but a polyfill capability
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: to me a feature flag doesn't sound out of place; it may not be an engine capability that's being selected for, but a polyfill capability

content.body: while a is terribly tempting, I do think a feature flag is more expressive and therefore preferable to implicit changes, like b, where understanding the choice is predicated on deeper knowledge
